page.title: 01LANDSCAPE & BUILDINGS
page.content: Our block is a rural area with one small village(Pelynt)close to the holiday resort of Looe. The land is a plateau(300-400ft)much dissected by deep river valleys.The very deep valley of the W Looe river,makes communication to the east difficult.Apart from the B3359,all roads are narrow and require passing places for traffic.Hedges are of the high Cornish type and support a rich variety of plant species.Trees grow in valleys but are scarce elsewhere. Older houses are stone built with slate roofs,but on the newer estates,houses are made with blocks and have tiled roofs.Cob walls(Earth and straw)were once common but none now remain.The church was built in the 15th century on the site of a previous Norman building.The old school and school house were built in 1860.
